intro: Machaerium glabripes, commonly known as the silky machaerium, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Leguminosae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and feathery, bipinnate leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in dense, cylindrical spikes. Its seeds are enclosed in small, pod-like fruits that split open when mature. Machaerium glabripes is often found in grasslands and open woodlands, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
